heading: Consul Overview
subheading: Use Consul to automate network configurations, discover services, and enable secure connectivity across any cloud or runtime.

blocks.heading: Introduction to Consul
blocks.text: In this guide we cover what Consul is, what problems it can solve, how it compares to existing software, and how you can get started using it.

cards.heading: Consul Reference Documentation
cards.text: The documentation is reference material for all available features and options of Consul

cards.heading: Consul CLI
cards.text: Consul is controlled via a very easy to use command-line interface (CLI).

cards.heading: Consul API
cards.text: The main interface to Consul is a RESTful HTTP API. The API can perform basic CRUD operations on nodes, services, checks, configuration, and more.

cards.heading: Consul Install
cards.text: Please download the proper package for your operating system and architecture.

cards.heading: Connect
cards.text: Consul Connect provides service-to-service connection authorization and encryption...

cards.heading: Services
cards.text: One of the main goals of service discovery is to provide a catalog of available services.

cards.heading: Getting Started
cards.text: Consul is a networking tool that provides a fully featured service mesh and service discovery.
